bibl.title: Letter, George Paine in Boston, Mass. to Ebenezer Hazard in Philadelphia, Pa., 1796 Dec. 12
bibl.note: Insurance Company of North America Records, 1792 December 1 - 1843 February 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: at Office of Insurance Company of North American

Inclosed is a power of attorney from my Brother Thomas Paine to me to sell Six hundred & fifty Shares in the North America Insurance Company. Consequently I have taken the Liberty to extend a power of Substituion to you to Sell the shares or part as we may advise.

I wish you to sell all the above 650 shares as soon as You can for as much as they will fetch in Cash and as you sell Remit to me in Bank Notes on the Branch Bank in Boston or in Notes of some Bank in Boston. (We prefer Post Notes) deducting your usualy Comm. for doing such Business. - My Brother wrote to me the 7th Ins. informing that he had sent the Certificates to you (I believe by Capt. German from Charleston So. Carlonia)- the
last prices of N. A. Ins. Co. I have . that I have heard quoted was - 37. or 40. WmCt advance if you can sell at or very near these prices to sell as I want the money to pay Drafts of T. Paine.
